translated: Jātaka
The Dvādasakanipāta
The Cūḷakuṇālavagga
The Merchant-Seafarer Birth Story
“Those people who plough and sow
and live off the fruits of their labor,
are not a part of this island,

analyzed: jambu dīpāḥ idam eva naḥ vara
translated: so this is better for us, the Rose-Apple Island.”

analyzed: ti pañca rattu upagatamhi cande  vegaḥ mahā sāgarassa
translated: “When the moon is three nights past the full,🔽the great force of the ocean surges;
it will carry off this lofty island,
so don’t be killed! Go to another shelter.”
“Never will the force of the ocean’s waters
carry off this lofty island.
I’ve seen it with many signs,
so don’t be afraid! Why be sad? Be happy!

analyzed: pahūta bhakkham bahu anna pāna  pattatthe āvāsam imam uḷāra
translated: There’s plenty of food, and much food and drink,🔽so you’ve found this lofty shelter.
I don’t see any danger at all,
so be happy with your children and grandchildren.”
“The god who rules in the southern direction
commands that we be safe. That’s true.
The north doesn’t know about fear or safety,
so don’t be afraid! Why be sad? Be happy!”

original: “Yathā ime vippavadanti yakkhā,🔽Eko bhayaṁ saṁsati khemameko;
analyzed: yathā ime vippavadanti yakkhā  ekaḥ bhayam sasati khemam ekaḥ
translated: “As these demons are disputing,🔽One says there is fear, the other says there is safety.
Now listen to my words,
Quickly, lest we all perish.

original: Sabbe samāgamma karoma nāvaṁ,🔽Doṇiṁ daḷhaṁ sabbayantūpapannaṁ;🔽Sace ayaṁ dakkhiṇo saccamāha,
analyzed: sabbe samāgamma karoma nāva  doṇim daḷham  sace ayam dakkhiṇaḥ saccam āha
translated: All of us together, let us build a boat,🔽A strong boat with all the necessary equipment.🔽If this one on the right speaks the truth,
The other one on the left speaks in vain.

analyzed: sā ca iva naḥ hehiti āpadatthā
translated: That very thing will be our refuge in the calamity,

original: Imañca dīpaṁ na pariccajema.🔽Sace ca kho uttaro saccamāha,
analyzed: imam ca dīpam na pariccajema  sace ca kho uttaraḥ saccam āha
translated: And we will not abandon this island.🔽But if the one on the left speaks the truth,
The other one on the right speaks in vain.
All of us, having boarded that very boat,
In this way we will safely cross to the other shore.
One should not hastily take the first as best,
Having taken the youngest who has come within reach;

analyzed: yaḥ ci idha taccham paviceyya gaṇhati
translated: But the one who here discerns and takes the true one,

original: Sa ve naro seṭṭhamupeti ṭhānaṁ.🔽Yathāpi te sāgaravārimajjhe,
analyzed: sa ve naraḥ seṭṭham upeti  yathā api te sāgara vāri majjhe
translated: That man attains the best position.
Just as those merchants were safely brought out from the middle of the ocean
By their own actions, having penetrated the future goal,
The one of great wisdom did not neglect even a little.
The foolish, greedy for flavors, through delusion,
Do not understand what is to come.
They sink in the present, in the arising of things,
Like those people in the middle of the ocean.
Do what must be done before it is too late,

analyzed: mā mama kiccam kicca kāle byadhesi
translated: So that when the time comes, it will not torment you.
That one who does what must be done before it is too late,

analyzed: na tam kiccam kicca kāle byadheti iti
translated: That task will not torment him when the time comes.”
The Birth Story of Samuddavāṇija (Third).
